Elections and Voting

General Election items for consideration may include City Council places, charter amendments, bonds, and CIP projects. Election ballots may also include county, school district, and state propositions.

The 2026 General Election will be held on May 2, 2026, at Corinth City Hall, 3300 Corinth Parkway, Corinth, Texas 76208 for Mayor and Place 5.

City Council Members serve three-year terms, at large.

Candidate qualifications are as follows:

  • Shall be a qualified voter
  • Shall be at least twenty-one (21) years of age
  • Shall have resided in the City for 12 months immediately preceding the election
  • Shall not be employed by the City
  • Shall meet all other eligibility requirements of the Texas Election Code

For more information on elections, please visit the City Secretary FAQ page or the Texas Secretary of State website.

Voter ID Requirements
The Texas Secretary of State has issued new photo ID requirements for Texas voters. Voters who do not possess and cannot obtain one of the approved forms of identification, or for additional election information, please visit the Denton County Elections website or call (940) 349-3200.
